titles.title: Recognizing the importance of transatlantic relations between the United States and the European Union and recognizing the growing importance of the dialogue between Congress and the European Parliament.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary: 5/28/2010--Introduced. Congratulates the European Union (EU) on the 60th anniversary of the Schuman Declaration (celebrated as Europe Day) that led to the successful union of European nations and contributed to lasting peace and prosperity across the continent. Recognizes that the United States and the EU face common challenges at home and abroad and believes that a regular dialogue between Congress and the European Parliament is important in fostering the U.S.-EU relationship.
